summary: The App Store Accountability Act aims to protect children by requiring covered app stores to verify user ages and obtain verifiable parental consent before minors download or make in-app purchases. It defines age categories, outlines app store and developer obligations, and grants enforcement power to the Federal Trade Commission and state attorneys general. The bill includes provisions for compliance, safe harbors, preemption, and severability, and mandates guidelines from the FTC within a year of enactment.
